name: LiftFund
desc: Nonprofit CDFI (Community Development Financial Institution) founded in 1994, providing responsible small business loans in 15 states, with a focus on underserved entrepreneurs who don't qualify for traditional bank funding.

leaders.bg: Attorney who served as LiftFund's general counsel and chief external affairs officer before being named CEO.
Former nun who founded LiftFund (originally Accion Texas) in 1994 with three employees; retired after 30 years of leadership.

name: Pursuit Lending
desc: Non-profit CDFI providing 15+ small business loan programs including SBA 504, SBA 7(a), and SBA Microloans across Connecticut, New York, New Jersey, and Pennsylvania, having deployed $780M+ in PPP loans during COVID-19.

leaders.bg: Started as a 2010 intern, shaped Pursuit's credit philosophy and deployed $780M+ in PPP loans before becoming CEO in 2022.
Oversees all credit functions including analysis, internal lending, lender service provider teams, and portfolio management.
Oversees the metropolitan New York market including NYC, Long Island, Northern NJ, and Hudson Valley.

name: Driven (formerly Thinking Capital)
desc: Canadian fintech small business lender, part of Purpose Unlimited, providing flexible capital to Canadian SMBs through a digital lending platform, rebranded from Thinking Capital in 2022.

leaders.bg: Veteran with 25+ years of product development and leadership experience; joined Driven in 2021 and leads the Canadian SMB lending operation.
Founder of Purpose Unlimited; University of Toronto engineering grad who started at RBC Investment Banking; completed acquisition of Steadyhand in 2025.

name: Mission Capital
desc: New York-based small business funder (operating as SBG Funding) providing MCAs, business lines of credit, equipment financing, and working capital loans, ranked No. 831 on Inc. 5000 with $250M+ funded to 4,500+ customers since 2017.

leaders.bg: Founded SBG Funding (also operating as Mission Capital LLC) in 2017; grew to Inc. 5000 recognition with $250M+ funded.

name: GoCurrency
desc: Financial technology arm of Sandhills Global providing equipment financing, leasing, working capital, and aviation financing solutions across the US and Canada for construction, agriculture, transport, and other industries.

leaders.bg: Leads Currency (GoCurrency) as the financial technology arm of Sandhills Global.
Oversees the Currency team at Sandhills Global, helping buyers and sellers facilitate financing through various financial products.

name: Interface Financial Group
desc: North America's largest alternative funding source for small businesses, providing invoice factoring and short-term financial resources through 140+ franchise offices with 39+ years of experience, generating $69M in annual revenue.

leaders.bg: Elected CEO and Chairman in 2007, Executive Chairman in 2019; accomplished international executive with 25+ years of business-building in emerging markets.
Leads financial technology initiatives across Interface Financial Group's 140+ office network.

name: Libertas
desc: Leading fintech based in Greenwich, CT offering revenue-based financing and working capital solutions to SMBs, with new CEO John Paradisi bringing 25+ years of banking experience and a new CIO from Citadel.

leaders.bg: 25+ years in commercial/consumer banking, specialty lending, and capital markets; previously EVP and Chief Specialty Banking Officer at City National Bank of Florida.
Former CEO transitioning to Vice Chairman; continues on board, credit committee, and supporting underwriting team on complex transactions.
Over 20 years of investment experience including portfolio management at Citadel; promoted to oversee financial risk, underwriting, and portfolio management.

name: BasePoint Capital LLC
desc: Major MCA specialty finance platform deploying $14.5B+ in cumulative financing through subsidiaries Pearl Capital and Revenued, with $4.9B in outstanding principal balance and recent $102M ABS securitization.

leaders.bg: Leads BasePoint Capital's specialty finance operations including Pearl Capital and Revenued MCA platforms.

name: The LCF Group
desc: New York-based direct funder of merchant cash advances specializing in funding high-risk and hard-to-fund businesses, with $17.5M in annual revenue and a focus on fast business funding from future receivables.

leaders.bg: Leads The LCF Group's operations as a direct MCA funder specializing in high-risk and hard-to-fund businesses.

name: Avtech Capital
desc: National equipment finance and leasing company based in Salt Lake City, UT, founded in 2001, funding commercial equipment leases across healthcare, manufacturing, aircraft, technology, construction, mining, and transportation.

leaders.bg: Leads Avtech Capital's national equipment finance operations from their headquarters in the greater Salt Lake City area.
Oversees financial operations for Avtech Capital's multi-industry equipment leasing business.

name: Newity LLC
desc: Leading SBA 7(a) loan facilitator and technology platform, ranked #1 in SBA 7(a) loans up to $500K, co-founded by David Cody and Luke LaHaie, named to Inc. 5000 at No. 596 and recognized by American Banker.

leaders.bg: Over 30 years of business development, asset management, and capital formation experience; founded NEWITY to help underserved entrepreneurs access affordable SBA funding.
Co-founded NEWITY after recognizing gaps in PPP relief access; named to American Banker's '25 People Who Will Change Banking in 2025'.

name: Hello Alice
desc: AI-powered platform connecting 1.5M+ small business owners to grants, funding, networks, and mentorship, founded by Carolyn Rodz and Elizabeth Gore, with $57M+ in grants distributed and Series C funding.

leaders.bg: Co-founded Hello Alice in 2017 to provide equitable opportunities for small businesses in marginalized communities.
Launched a podcast with Yahoo Finance featuring major entrepreneurs; leads Hello Alice's strategic partnerships and public presence.

name: Purpose Unlimited
desc: Canadian financial services holding company led by Som Seif, spanning asset management, wealth management, and small business financing through subsidiaries including Driven Financial and Purpose Investments.

leaders.bg: University of Toronto engineering grad; started at RBC Investment Banking; built Purpose Unlimited into a diversified financial services group with $1.3B+ in AUM.
25+ years of product development and leadership experience; leads the SMB lending subsidiary.

name: Commercial Funding Inc.
desc: Utah-based subsidiary of Commercial Credit Inc. providing invoice factoring, accounts receivable financing, and asset-based loans to middle-market companies nationwide, founded in 2004 by Dan McDonough.

leaders.bg: Founded Commercial Credit Inc. in 2004; career in equipment finance since 1986 starting as a credit analyst at First Interstate Credit Alliance, MBA from DePaul University.
Recently added VP bringing additional leadership to Commercial Funding's growth.

name: Cuallix
desc: Monterrey-based fintech with 25+ years in credit and payment processing across Mexico, US, and Hong Kong. Operates multiple platforms including Cuallet (digital banking) and Payllix (global payments/transfers).

leaders.bg: Cuallix leadership oversees a $514M revenue fintech operation spanning three countries with 60+ employees.

name: Knight Capital Funding
desc: Fort Lauderdale-based direct MCA funder specializing in merchant cash advances for small businesses across the US, with funding decisions in under 72 hours.

leaders.bg: Founded Knight Capital Funding in 2013; attended University of Miami Herbert Business School.
Manages Knight Capital's branding, marketing, affiliate onboarding, and web development.

name: Ualett
desc: Delaware-based fintech providing cash advances to gig economy workers (rideshare drivers, couriers, 1099 workers) via a mobile app, using real-time earnings verification instead of credit checks.

leaders.bg: Dominican-led founder who launched Ualett in 2018 to serve the underbanked gig economy.
20+ years driving revenue growth across tech and real estate; formerly SVP Revenue at Dwolla.

name: Dakota Financial
desc: Los Angeles-based asset-based direct funder specializing in equipment financing for trucking, construction, agriculture, and manufacturing, serving clients with challenging credit histories since 2002.

leaders.bg: Leads Dakota Financial's strategy, overseeing equipment financing operations that have served 15,000+ customers across all 50 states.
Manages financial operations for Dakota Financial's asset-based lending programs ranging from $15K to $400K.

name: Fundura Capital
desc: Online small business lending marketplace (operating as Fundera, now owned by NerdWallet) that connects entrepreneurs with multiple lenders for term loans, SBA loans, lines of credit, and equipment financing.

leaders.bg: Serial entrepreneur who co-founded GroupMe (sold to Microsoft) before launching Fundera in 2013; now Venture Partner at Union Square Ventures.
Technology entrepreneur who co-founded Fundera to bring transparency to online lending.

name: Business Capital LLC
desc: Hallandale Beach, FL-based direct funder providing same-day merchant cash advances, revenue-based financing, and working capital to businesses nationwide, recently rebranded as BusinessCapital.com.

leaders.bg: Founded Business Capital LLC as a direct funder; recently led rebrand to BusinessCapital.com with real-time underwriting platform.
Leads day-to-day operations at Business Capital with focus on same-day funding capabilities.

name: SouthStar Capital
desc: Mount Pleasant, SC-based specialty finance company providing invoice factoring, accounts receivable financing, asset-based lending, and purchase order financing to businesses nationwide.

leaders.bg: 25+ years in financial services; built multiple companies exceeding $20M/year revenue in under 5 years; began career in commercial banking.
Leads operational strategy at SouthStar Capital's specialty finance operations.

name: Swift Capital
desc: Small business lending company (acquired by PayPal in 2017 for $183M) that provided working capital loans up to $500K, now integrated into PayPal's business lending operations.

leaders.bg: PayPal acquired Swift Capital in 2017 to expand its small business lending capabilities and increase loan amounts to $500K.

name: Swift Financial Corporation
desc: Delaware-based small business lending company (now part of PayPal after 2017 acquisition) that pioneered fast working capital solutions for SMBs with loans up to $500K.

leaders.bg: Swift Financial was established in 2006 in Wilmington, DE, and acquired by PayPal in 2017 for $183M to enhance SMB lending.

name: US Business Funding
desc: Santa Ana, CA-based small business lender (est. 2008) providing working capital loans, merchant cash advances, SBA loans, and flexible business loans to SMBs nationwide.

leaders.bg: Founded US Business Funding in 2008; featured in deBanked discussing growth strategies and industry success.

name: BusinessLoans.com
desc: Charleston, SC-based online lending marketplace (est. 2020) that matches small business borrowers with lenders for short-term loans, long-term loans, lines of credit, and merchant cash advances.

leaders.bg: BusinessLoans.com has helped over 100,000 small businesses prequalify since its 2020 founding in Charleston, SC.

name: QuickBridge Funding, LLC
desc: Irvine, CA-based alternative small business lender (subsidiary of National Funding) providing fast working capital loans up to $400K with A+ BBB rating and 4.8-star Trustpilot reviews.

leaders.bg: Founded QuickBridge in 2011; continued leadership after National Funding acquisition in 2018.
Founder of National Funding who acquired QuickBridge to expand the company's alternative lending portfolio.

name: CoFi Lending
desc: Utah-based fintech specializing in construction finance with a proprietary software platform that streamlines the draw process, serving small-to-mid-size builders with loans from $250K to $60M.

leaders.bg: Former residential real estate developer who experienced construction loan pain points firsthand before co-founding CoFi.
Former residential developer with 30+ years construction and lending experience; built CoFi's proprietary payment platform.

name: Novel Capital
desc: Kansas City-based fintech providing non-dilutive, revenue-based financing to B2B SaaS companies, with $90M+ deployed to hundreds of tech companies through its Capital Intelligence platform.

leaders.bg: Previously co-founded EdTech startup Netchemia (sold to Vista Equity Partners); MBA from University of Kansas; originally from Bolivia.
Former Managing Director at KBA leading $591M fund investments in digital health and biotech.

name: The Fundworks
desc: Salt Lake City-based direct MCA funder providing revenue-based financing to small businesses, with funding in as little as one business day and terms up to 180 days.

leaders.bg: Founded The Fundworks in 2015 as a direct MCA funder focused on revenue-based financing.
Leads day-to-day operations at The Fundworks, managing the company's direct funding and merchant relationships.

name: Capital Infusion LLC
desc: Miami-based alternative business lender providing working capital loans, revolving lines of credit, equipment financing, SBA loans, and merchant cash advances from $5K to $5M+ since 2019.

leaders.bg: Decades of industry experience; previously Regional Director at ForwardLine Financial and Area Sales Manager at CAN Capital; began career at JPMorgan Chase.

name: Kalamata Capital Group
desc: Bethesda, MD-based MCA funder providing revenue-based financing up to $750K with same-day funding, backed by a $500M+ securitization facility and proprietary Kalamata Cash platform.

leaders.bg: Previously owned Rapid Financial Services (sold to Rockbridge Growth Equity in 2013); founded Kalamata named after his Greek heritage.
One of Kalamata's first employees; now leads co-presidential team managing $1B+ in funding operations.

name: Capital Crossing
desc: Boston-based commercial loan acquirer and servicer (est. 1987) specializing in underwriting and investing in small balance commercial real estate and C&I loans under $20M.

leaders.bg: Manages Capital Crossing's operations in acquiring and servicing discounted commercial loan pools nationwide for 25+ years.

name: Bizfund LLC
desc: Delaware-based MCA funder (operating as New Era Lending) providing merchant cash advances and short-term funding to small businesses with 6+ months operating history and $10K+ monthly revenue.

leaders.bg: Former President and founder of Pearl Capital (2009-2012); previously led New Era Lending before BizFund.

name: Republic Business Credit
desc: New Orleans-based specialty lender (subsidiary of Renasant Bank) providing asset-based lending, factoring, and e-commerce lending to entrepreneurial and PE-owned businesses nationwide since 2011.

leaders.bg: 20+ years of commercial finance experience across two continents; built Republic from startup to national lender.
Appointed President in 2016; leads national sales team building and business development.

name: Ampla Technologies Inc.
desc: New York-based fintech (acquired by FundThrough in 2025) that provided tech-enabled financing to consumer brands with $2B+ in originations, including lines of credit, corporate cards, and extended payment terms.

leaders.bg: Founded Ampla in 2019; grew it to $2B+ in originations before FundThrough acquisition; now serves as strategic advisor.
Co-founded FundThrough and led the acquisition of Ampla in April 2025 alongside $25M Series B.

name: Northern Initiatives
desc: Michigan-based nonprofit CDFI providing affordable small business loans ($1K-$500K) across all 73 Michigan counties, with coaching and resources for entrepreneurs who don't qualify for traditional banks.

leaders.bg: Third president of Northern Initiatives; previously spent 13 years directing Local First, a nonprofit working with 1,000+ businesses in west Michigan.
Oversees all lending operations across Northern Initiatives' 7 offices statewide.

name: Porter Capital
desc: Birmingham, AL-based family-owned invoice factoring company (est. 1991) providing credit lines from $25K to $25M, approaching $15B in cumulative funding with $1.7B funded in 2025 alone.

leaders.bg: Founded Porter Capital in 1991 with brother Donald; Auburn University business degree; named Small Business Person of the Year by Birmingham Chamber.
23-year veteran at Porter Capital managing financial operations as the company approaches $15B in cumulative funding.

name: CoreTech Leasing
desc: Newport Beach, CA-based independent technology and equipment lessor specializing in leasing for law firms, corporations, medical/educational institutions, and manufacturing enterprises since 2008.

leaders.bg: Previously VP Legal Services at U.S. Bank Oliver-Allen Technology Leasing for 13 years before founding CoreTech in 2008.
25+ year career dedicated to best practices in the finance industry; oversees operations and customer experience.

name: TwinFold Capital
desc: Los Angeles-based family-owned business financing company (est. 2008) providing working capital and merchant financing up to $1M to SMBs across all industries with fast 24-72 hour funding.

leaders.bg: TwinFold Capital has been privately held and family-owned since 2008, putting integrity at the forefront of operations.

name: Monet Capital
desc: Brooklyn, NY-based fintech lender (est. 2017) providing SBA loans, working capital, term loans, lines of credit, and real estate funding, with 20,000+ businesses funded and $1B+ deployed.

leaders.bg: Founded Monet Capital in 2017; built the company to $1B+ in funding across 700+ industries.
Leads business development and lending operations at Monet Capital.
